basics.name: Alessandra Gudoy
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

courses: ICS 211: Introduction to Computer Science II

work.summary: Provided customer service and maintained a clean and safe restaurant
highlights: Sweep and mopping in the dining and meeting customers
Serving regular customers and providing good customer service to keep them coming back

work.company: Research Corporation of University of Hawaii
highlights: Using simulations to record data in a spreadsheet

volunteer.summary: Working in teams, we built and programmed robots and documented our progress in the VEX and FRC robotics competitions. As a programmer, I helped with the robot’s movements and the functionality of the scouting app to gather data on other teams.
highlights: Working with builders and documenters to discuss the progress on the robot/scouting app
Testing and troubleshooting code to make the robot move and execute tasks
Moving on to the State Round by being in the top percent in our division with respect to our tier
Working with a partner to make sure the network was up and had no security issues

awards.title: Provost Achievement Scholarship
awards.awarder: The University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen residing in Hawaii following the semester they complete high school with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.7.

awards.title: AP Scholar Award with Distinction
awards.summary: Awarded to students who score on average at least 3.5 on all AP Exams taken and scores of 3 or higher on five or more of these exams.
